intro: Oldenlandia papillosa, commonly known as the silky knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. Oldenlandia papillosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
